title: CSS Attribute Selectors
subject: CSS
theory:
Attribute selectors allow you to style elements that have specific attributes or attribute values.

*   `[attribute]`: Selects elements with this attribute.
*   `[attribute="value"]`: Exact match.
*   `[attribute^="value"]`: Starts with.
*   `[attribute$="value"]`: Ends with.
*   `[attribute*="value"]`: Contains substring.

examples.explanation: Useful for indicating file types to users.

common_mistakes.correction: Attribute values are case-sensitive by default.

interview_questions.question: How do you select all images with 'logo' in their src?

practice_problems.problem: Style all links that point to https://google.com.

real_world_use_cases.description: Targeting `input[type='submit']` vs `input[type='text']` without adding extra classes.

exam_notes: ~= requires distinct words separated by spaces.
summary: Attribute selectors provide granular control without polluting your HTML with classes.
